headline.main: Curbing the Enthusiasm on Daily Multivitamins
headline.print_headline: Curbing the Enthusiasm On Daily Multivitamins

docs.abstract: Experts are concerned about letting optimism about the potential benefits of nutritional supplements get ahead of the scientific evidence.
docs.snippet: Experts are concerned about letting optimism about the potential benefits of nutritional supplements get ahead of the scientific evidence.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sweet or savory, pancakes freeze well and can be a wholesome treat any day of the week. Today: Poppy, Lemon and Sunflower Seed Pancakes.

headline.seo: Poppy, Lemon and Sunflower Seed Pancakes
headline.main: Whole-Grain Pancakes: Not Just for Breakfast Anymore

docs.snippet: Sweet or savory, pancakes freeze well and can be a wholesome treat any day of the week. Today: Poppy, Lemon and Sunflower Seed Pancakes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Eating Well is trying to forge its path in a world without Gourmet magazine, while avoiding high-calorie comfort food that became a popular topic during the recession.

headline.seo: Eating Well Magazine’s New Lease on Life
headline.main: A Sale Gives a Magazine on Healthy Eating a New Lease on Life
headline.print_headline: A Sale Gives a Magazine on Healthy Eating a New Lease on Life

docs.abstract: Eating Well magazine, reinvigorated after $29 million buyout from Meredith Corp, is attempting to forge a path to success in troubled food magazine industry following closure of Gourmet magazine; company, which caters to healthy eaters, has eschewed promoting rich comfort foods that many other publications have focused on during the recession.
docs.snippet: Eating Well is trying to forge its path in a world without Gourmet magazine, while avoiding high-calorie comfort food that became a popular topic during the recession.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the liberal Democratic faithful, Mr. McGovern remained a standard-bearer well into old age, writing and lecturing even as his name was routinely invoked by conservatives as synonymous with what they considered the failures of liberal politics.

headline.seo: George McGovern, a Liberal Trounced but Not Silenced, Dies at 90
headline.main: George McGovern Dies at 90, a Liberal Trounced but Never Silenced
headline.print_headline: A Prairie Liberal, Trounced but Never Silenced

docs.abstract: George McGovern, United States senator who won Democratic Party's presidential nomination in 1972 as opponent of war in Vietnam and champion of liberal causes, and who was then trounced by Pres Richard M Nixon in general election, dies at age 90; McGovern remained standard-bearer to liberal Democratic faithful well into his old age.
docs.snippet: To the liberal Democratic faithful, Mr. McGovern remained a standard-bearer well into old age, writing and lecturing even as his name was routinely invoked by conservatives as synonymous with what they considered the failures of liberal politics.

byline.contributor: David E. Rosenbaum, a Washington correspondent for The New York Times, died in 2006. William McDonald contributed reporting.
